author: Jenny Strasburg
title: Deutsche Bank Executive Marcus Schenck Has Discussed Exit From Company
text:
Deutsche Bank AG’s German investment-banking co-head, Marcus Schenck, has been in discussions about leaving the lender as soon as next month, according to a person familiar with the matter.
Mr. Schenck’s discussions haven’t been reported previously. The executive has been seen by some investors and others close to the bank as one of a handful of potential internal candidates to one day become chief executive.
